cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 280 mi ESE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting northwest, expected to cross the north-western Bahamas then lift along or just off Florida’s east coast and parallel the Georgia–South Carolina shoreline early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: could brush the east-central Florida coast near Cape Canaveral, but official forecast keeps the center just offshore

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet FL northward to the Flagler–Volusia County line FL (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northwestern Bahamas excluding Andros Island (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coastline from central Florida northward through coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Sunday night through Monday as the system passes offshore to the east
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (1–2 ft) possible in the St. Simons/Brunswick area during high tides if the center passes close to shore
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rainfall possible with locally higher pockets, mainly Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Choppy seas and hazardous marine conditions for inbound/outbound vessels beginning late Sunday
